statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Jordan Lyons scored a career-high 19 points off the bench, including five 3-pointers, Daniel Fowler scored 14 points with six assists, Matt Rafferty scored 13 and pulled down 11 rebounds and Furman walloped NAIA Montreat 103-47 Thursday night.
article.headline: Lyons scores 19 off bench, Furman tops NAIA Montreat 103-47
article.linkText: Lyons scores 19 off bench, Furman tops NAIA Montreat 103-47
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. -- Jordan Lyons scored a career-high 19 points off the bench, including five 3-pointers, Daniel Fowler scored 14 points with six assists, Matt Rafferty scored 13 and pulled down 11 rebounds and Furman walloped NAIA Montreat 103-47 Thursday night. The Paladins won their fourth straight and found minutes for all 13 players with 11 scoring, six in double figures. John Davis III and Clayton Mounce each scored 13 points (a career-high for Mounce), Devin Sibley added 12 for Furman (8-3), which shot an even 50 percent with 27 assists on 39 made field goals. The assists and points scored were season highs. Furman has won seven of its last eight games and out-rebounded the Cavaliers 53-36. Jalen Williams had 11 boards and nine points. Montreat (12-2) was held to 18 baskets on 68 tries (27 percent), and was led by Jeron Hemphill and David Caldwell with seven points each. Hemphill and Caldwell also had five rebounds apiece.
